mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: It was built in 1875 adjacent to the Erie Canal, and, at 170 feet tall, was the tallest building in Syracuse. It opened in 1876 as Syracuse Savings Bank. Its passenger elevator, the first in Syracuse, was a curiosity that drew visitors. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syracuse_Savings_Bank_Building [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
financial institutions (buildings)
Bank of America
mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 102 N. Salina Street, Syracuse, Onondaga, New York, United States
